title: Diamond-Blackfan Anemia: Epidemiological Overview
short_description: Document providing epidemiological data on Diamond-Blackfan anemia, including incidence rates and demographic distribution.
long_description: This clinical research document presents key epidemiological statistics for Diamond-Blackfan anemia, a rare inherited bone marrow failure syndrome. The document details the global incidence rate of 5-7 cases per million live births annually, translating to approximately 25-35 new cases per year in the United States based on 4 million annual births. It also notes that there are roughly 5,000 cases worldwide and that the condition affects males and females equally, providing important baseline data for understanding the prevalence and demographic characteristics of this rare hematological disorder.
